text: [Music]
hi Phil nice to see you again welcome to
the AWS enterprise video series thanks
it's great to be here so this afternoon
we're going to be talking about building
teams for cloud so why don't we get
started by just sharing some experiences
on how it's different to build teams for
the cloud versus building teams for
traditional IT well I think first of all
a lot of organizations will start by
thinking that they need to build an
outside team or hire a group of cloud
specialists and really I I've seen
organizations be successful with the
individuals that they already have in
their organization and obviously that
comes through training and experience
but you just don't want to train a bunch
of individuals on your team for the
cloud and and deposit them back in the
same IT operating model so it's
important to pair that training of your
internal teams and that investment
you're making with your cloud operating
model and and actually how groups will
function and that with the cloud and
that one of the key elements of that is
creating a cloud center of excellence
and that cloud center of excellence is a
cross-functional group of individuals in
your organization from security to
infrastructure to product development
and software engineering we're all
working together on your initial
projects in the cloud to show success
and to really establish that new
operating model so that as you train
individuals they are able to follow in
that same pattern and your cloud
operating model in your cloud center of
excellence matures and continues to
provide new learnings to the
organization and your
we trained team so that from what I
understand then this is an iterative and
collaborative model so what are what are
the best places for an organization to
start well going back to the cloud
center of excellence that's a great
place to build your core cloud
capability and grow it but really
there's not a a one-size-fits-all
approach there I've seen organizations
build very large teams and put them in a
completely separate building isolated
from all of the legacy parts of the
business and then I've seen other
organizations deposit their Cloud Center
of Excellence in the middle of all of
the existing projects and figure out how
to adapt and really the the right answer
somewhere in the middle probably where
most organizations fall and they're able
to build that capability with some
visibility to the rest of the
organization so that they'll be able to
see some of the evidence of of what the
cloud is capable of offering so what are
some of your thoughts about why AWS is
the best platform for building teams in
the cloud well I think that the training
and certification is an important aspect
in AWS has spent a lot of effort and put
a lot of focus into providing programs
that across different technical levels
that ensure there's a different persona
for certification for different personas
in the organization whether you're a
developer or an architect and or a
project manager and so organ a lot of
organizations are using certifications
as a baseline for their progress and
maturity and can even correlate their
progress in their migrations to the
number of certified individuals for
organizations that don't have all of the
team that they would like at this point
to achieve all of their goals in
leveraging the cloud the AWS partner
network is a pretty common option for
enterprises to use almost in a pair
programming or to augment their staff
and accelerate some of the adoption that
great so it's interesting to hear that
this is beyond your team it might
actually involve some outside resources
so in in closing are there any last
thoughts or parting words that you would
like to share with the audience yeah I
think when you think about the cloud and
the right team for to achieve value with
it I think you should really expand the
view of what that could be because I've
seen success with in cloud teams that
have come from test automation groups
from the infrastructure team and from
the software engineering team either
working together or individually and so
I don't think there's a single mold that
you have to follow it's really the
individuals that you think are going to
deliver the most value for those types
of initiatives great thank you so much
appreciated glad to be
